839316632:
[

Engineer, Instrumentation & Control, TSL Delivery

Company Name Outotec Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 251 views

Job description

We currently have an opportunity in the TSL (Ausmelt Top Submerged Lance smelting) group for an Instrumentation and Control Engineer to assist in the delivery of TSL projects. The role is based at our Pilot Plant in Dandenong South, Victoria reporting to the Head of Global Equipment Delivery Centre.

As Engineer, Instrumentation & Control, TSL Delivery, You Will
  • Responsible for implementation of Instrumentation design for projects including all documentation and Manuals -– sizing and selection of different types of instruments (including transmitters, valves, analyzers) for metals and mineral processing applications that include hazardous areas, generation of instrument index, datasheets, mechanical and electrical hookup diagrams , junction box schedules and cable schedules.
  • Responsible for executing Control system design and for projects including all documentation and Manuals - I/O lists, alarm lists, interlock charts, functional descriptions, sizing and selection, and development.
  • Responsible for Control Panel design including sizing, selection, general arrangement, wiring and termination diagrams using Eplan, Intools and/or similar tools.
  • Managing control system programming for the projects .
  • Oversee draftsperson’s drawings, provide instructions on design requisites and ensure technical accuracy.
  • Responsible for Instrumentation and controls engineering component of projects. This include managing development of P&IDs in collaboration with other disciplines (Drafting, Process, Mechanical & Piping).
  • Responsible for participation in all PCM (Product Compliance Management) activities (Functional Safety Management) and implementing the I & C components of PCM.
  • Responsible for supervision of I & C equipment installations, workshop and site commissioning of I & C equipment.
  • Support procurement activities: enquiry preparation, bid evaluation, workshop inspections and factory acceptance testing.
To succeed, you will need:
  • At least 3-5 years of design experience in a medium to large metals and mining industry projects.
  • Engineering Graduate with Computer Systems/ Instrumentation & Controls as the major specialization
  • A thorough understanding of Instrumentation & Controls engineering principles and practices.
  • Experience with risk assessment, HAZOP studies, SIL allocation and similar activities.
  • Experience with design tools like Eplan, Intools desired.
  • Experience with DCS programming for Yokogawa Centum VP, Rockwell Studio 5000 & FTView Studio and Siemens PCS 7 desired.
  • Strong diagnostic, problem solving and decision making skills covering design through to plant operation project phases
  • Ability to self manage, work as part of a team and deliver multiple projects concurrently
  • Good communication and presentation skills.
  • Willingness for infrequent, short-term travel.
If you thrive on a challenge and want to make an impact to our global fast based business, please apply by visiting http://www.outotec.com/en/Careers/Jobs-at-Outotec/ by close of business 21 September 2018.
Please note that shortlisted candidates will need Australian working rights and may be asked to agree to medical and background profiling including police clearance.

Opening date: 2018-08-29
Closing date: 2018-09-21

Industry

  • Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing
  • Mechanical or Industrial Engineering
  • Mining & Metals

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Engineering
  • Information Technology

Business Development Manager - Corporate Sales

  • Highly competitive salary package & uncapped commission

The Opportunity:
Are you looking for a Business Development Manager role with a fully supporting team?
 Our client is a leading international venue services business who is currently growing their sales team and they're looking for you.
As a Business Development Manager, you will work closely with the General Manager and internal department to target and win new SME & corporate business. This role will have a strong emphasis on potential SMB and corporate partnerships.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Attend qualified face-to-face sales appointments for moving the business forward and demonstrating account management business practices increasing client retention.
  • Generate quality customised proposals/tender documents.
  • Source and secure new business in Tier 1,2,3 and 4 clients.
  • Effectiveness of converting company generated leads to clients.
  • Cross-sell and upsell all products and support services where possible with accounts throughout each year.

Specific Experience and Skill-Set:

  • Experience in dealing with C-suite managers
  • Targeting and winning SME to corporate clients
  • Excellent presentation and communication skills
  • Strong stakeholder management
  • Excellent pipeline management skills

[

Engineering Director

Company Name The Green Recruitment Company Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 141 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Summary:

\xa0

An international solar company that specialise in Solar PV solutions, project business; development, investment and EPC and solar products are hiring an Engineering Director for their global projects team in Melbourne.

\xa0

This business’ Australian operation currently own one utility scale solar farm with planned construction for early 2019 and are in the development stages for several other solar projects across Australia

\xa0

This company are seeking a professional with experience in the Australian utility scale solar sector and a background in engineering and the technical aspects of projects

This is an excellent opportunity for someone who seeks a new challenge with a forward thinking company who will able to influence wider company processes in the Australian solar PV markets


Responsibilities:

As Engineering Director, you will have the following responsibilities


  • Manage the technical team members (internal and external) to execute the project developments (and potential deployment) as per commitments and forecasts, and timeline
  • Supervise and guide design and engineering activities and ensure engineering designs meet local and international standards
  • Selection of EPC contractors and contract negotiation for upcoming projects. RFP management and EPC selection, EPC contract negotiation, engineering review
  • Develop and implement an OHS process in the Company
  • Prepare forecasts and budget for project development across the various markets
  • Support the design, planning and construction of new Solar racking systems, alterations and extensions to existing products or projects
  • Support the certification and designing of solar mounting structures so that they are code compliant, safe and effective

\xa0

Requirements:

You will have strong experience in EPC (with focus on design and engineering), and a demonstrated ability to effectively provide sound technical advice, exercise good business judgment, and work with senior management, other colleagues, external stakeholders, customers and regulators, in an international setup.

\xa0


Other requirements are:


  • Bachelor or master's degree in an Engineering Discipline - Electrical is preferred
  • Minimum of 5 years engineering experience in utility-scale PV or power generation
  • PR visa or Australian Citizenship
  • Fluency in English required; further language skills\xa0
  • Strong negotiating skills with EPC/O&M agreements and other ancillary agreements
  • Solid and effective interpersonal and communication skills (including oral, written and visual).
  • Experience engaging with and evaluating equipment vendors and service providers, engineering firms and EPC contractors
  • Ability to read & understand electrical, structural, mechanical & architectural drawings
  • Wide knowledge of relevant regulations and standards, electrical code, building codes, international design standards and OHS
  • Strong organisational and time management skills; the ability to multi-task and meet deadlines
  • Willingness to travel up to 50% or more of the time

\xa0

Momentum Search and Selection is working with several organisations who are undergoing major transformation initiatives in Digital, Innovation, Agile, DevOps and New Ways of Working.

We are looking for several Enterprise Level Agile Coaches/Tribe Leads for clients in Melbourne.

\xa0

About you:


Ideally you will have a strong project/program delivery background and will have transitioned into Agile Coaching roles several years ago. You have a proven track record of coaching teams/squads of around 10 teams and circa 100 people.

\xa0

You are an excellent stakeholder manager who can influence up to and including the C-Level.

\xa0

You excel in helping organisations to deliver at scale in Agile or CI/CD environments. You have multiple approaches as part of your tool kit such as Lean, DevOps, Human Centred Design and Design Thinking. You are pragmatic in your approach.

\xa0

You have a proven track record of working on customer centric initiatives.

\xa0

A server leader type style is beneficial; however, you have the ability to call out issues and get to the root cause of a problem quickly when needed.

\xa0

You are experienced in coaching Agile Coaches, Iteration Managers, Scrum Masters, and Product Owners as senior business leaders up to C-level.

\xa0

\xa0

You are experienced at overseeing large project/program portfolio and identifying issues around dependency management, risks and issues and taking the appropriate action to ensure that stream leads are delivering with transparency.

\xa0

You are an expert at choosing the right approach for the size and maturity of the organisation.

\xa0

The opportunity:


We are working with several organisations of different sizes with their own unique challenges. The roles which we are seeking to fill are permanent roles.

\xa0

We are interested in talking to candidates who thrive on change, influencing at all levels ( where possible ) and challenging the status quo.

\xa0

\xa0

We offer:


If this sounds like you, please contact Alan Herrity on 03 8592 6482 for a confidential conversation.

  • Manage a portfolio of 140 properties

About the Company

Our client has a long standing reputation for excellence, providing their customers with outstanding local knowledge and services in all aspects of residential and commercial real estate. As market leaders, they have a forward thinking philosophy that allows them to stay ahead of the pack.

With two offices in Banyule and large team of industry professionals, they are one of the original and most knowledgeable agents in the municipality.


About the Role

Joining the Commercial Property Management team, you will be in charge of a well-managed portfolio. Support and training will be provided to ensure you have the tools necessary for success in this position with the potential for future career development.


Tasks include but are not limited to:

  • Rent arrears
  • Routine Inspections
  • Liaise with landlords and tenants
  • Conduct final inspections

Role: Salesforce CICD Developer

Create and maintain fully automated Build & Continuous Integration framework for daily automated builds.
